question:
Which of the following actions can be taken by the President when a bill is sent to him after it has been passed by the Parliament?
1. give his assent to the bill
2. withhold his assent to the bill
3. return the bill (if it is not a money bill) for reconsideration of Parliament
4. make changes in the bill
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Whenever a bill is sent to the President after it has been passed by the Parliament, he has the option of: giving his assent to the bill, or withholding his assent to the bill, or returning the bill (if it is not a money bill) for reconsideration of Parliament.
